listing.description: No. 84 Hare Lane is one of a pair of elegant halls adjoining Edwardian family homes which have undergone a full programme of modernisation; with restoration and refurbishment from the ground up, the property provides a luxuriously appointed house in a ready to move in state – just add furniture and personal belongings to feel immediately at home! On the first floor are two large double bedrooms and a generous single with an oriel bay window. The family bathroom includes a large over bath rain shower, vanity basin and low level wc, finished to an exemplary standard with stylish floor and wall tiling. On the top floor is the master suite, with useful eaves storage accessed from the landing. This large l-shaped bedroom benefits from a luxurious en-suite shower room. Outside off road parking is available for two cars and the rear garden is fully enclosed with new fencing and a useful side access. The developer has paid tremendous attention to detail combining period style features such as high ceilings with cornicing, parquet flooring and elegant bathroom fitments, with the latest in contemporary lighting, double glazed ‘heritage style’ windows as well as underfloor heating in the kitchen. A canopied entrance porch leads into the generous reception hall, with a wide easy rising staircase to the first floor. A cloak room with tiled flooring and a concealed utility area in an under stairs storage cupboard are accessed from the hall.The high ceilinged living room has a bright easterly aspect through a bay window, it also features a stylish fireplace, spotlighting and parquet flooring. The expansive Kitchen/Family room has zoned areas including a sitting area with a fireplace recess and built in storage to either side of the chimney breast. The fitted shaker style kitchen has built in appliances and an island unit/breakfast bar; the dining area is set under a skylight which floods the room with light and the whole room is completed with bi-fold doors opening onto the south west facing garden.

listing.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this very well presented and thoughtfully modernised semi detached family home, situated in a highly sought after road in central Twickenham, offering easy access to the town centre and a short walk into Strawberry Hill village.The accommodation now offers a separate front reception room, good size open plan kitchen/family room, utility room and WC to the ground floor, whilst the upper two floors provide, three double bedrooms, a fourth single bedroom and two bathrooms.Further benefits include a well maintained south facing rear garden with a detached home office/garden room, private front garden and potential for further extension to the ground floor (stpp).There are good transports links in the area, with Twickenham station a short walk away and regular buses into Richmond (District line tube), Teddington and Kingston. And a short drive to the M3, with good access to the M25 and M4. The local area is well served for schools, both private and state-run.To arrange an appointment to view, please call the vendors’ Sole agents Chase Buchanan.

listing.description: SummaryLocated in a quiet private cul-de-sac in Whetstone is this five bedroom detached family home. This home benefits from two large reception rooms, double garage and modern fitted kitchen.DescriptionDating back to the 15th Century, Whetstone originated in medieval times, and legend has it that the name stems from the stone that is placed outside of the Griffin Pub, where soldiers went to sharpen their swords before the Battle of Barnet. Whetstone is perfect for both commuters and families alike. Located in zone 4, Totteridge and Whetstone northern line tube station offers easy access in and out of the city and central London, whilst also being only moments away from open countryside.Whetstone offers a vast range of architecture from period apartments boasting plenty of character, to large 1920's and 1930's houses, perfect for a growing family. Parts of Whetstone have benefited from modernisation in recent years, which have given rise to some luxury new builds that have incorporated the Help to buy scheme.In the centre of Whetstone is located the ever popular high street. Known for its range of cafes, restaurants and gastro-pubs, it was voted the Evening Standards healthiest high street of 2015. The surrounding area also benefits from a variety of fantastic local facilities, such as the South Herts golf club, the Totteridge tennis club and the All Saints Arts Centre. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A unique opportunity to purchase a substantial detached property with need of some modernisation and possible extension. The house has three floors and can be rearranged to create a lovely family property.The house has a lobby leading to a spacious hallway leading to a sitting room and family room. listing.description: A superior detached home on one of Ickenhams finest roads. The property requires full modernisation offering the opportunity to transform into a perfect family home.DirectionsLeaving our Ickenham office, turn left onto Swakeleys Road, just before the zebra crossing. The Avenue is situated off the second lay by on the left hand side.SituationThe Avenue is an exclusive tree lined private residential road that is regarded as one of Ickenham's most prestigious and sought after locations known for its grand houses with open and spacious gardens. It is a short stroll to the village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Primary & Vyners Senior School. To the end of the road is Ickenham Tennis Courts and the award winning Swakeleys Park, which has been recently renovated and enjoys beautiful scenery and woodland areas.DescriptionAn exceptionally attractive four bedroom detached house situated in one of Ickenham's most sought after roads. Requiring complete modernisation throughout, this characterful property offers abundant opportunities to create a stunning family home. The accommodation is entered via a spacious reception hall, through which there are doors to the two separate reception rooms, leading on from one of the reception rooms is the kitchen which is located to the read of the property. Additionally to the ground floor there is a guest cloakroom. The first floor offers four good sized bedrooms and a bathroom. The property requires full refurbishment throughout.OutsideThere is a large front garden mostly laid to lawn, and a driveway providing off-street parking for two/three vehicles. To the rear of the property there is a good sized garden, mostly laid to lawn with many mature trees providing immense privacy.
listing.short_description:
A superior detached home on one of Ickenhams finest roads. The property requires full modernisation offering the opportunity to transform into a perfect family home.

Directions

Leaving our Ickenham office, turn left onto Swakeleys Road, just before the zebra crossing. The Avenue is situated off the second lay by on the left hand side.

Situation

The Avenue is an exclusive tree lined private residential road that is regarded as one of Ickenham's most prestigious and sought after locations known for its grand houses with open and spacious gardens. It is a short stroll to the village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Primary & Vyners Senior School. To the end of the road is Ickenham Tennis Courts and the award winning Swakeleys Park, which has been recently renovated and enjoys beautiful scenery and woodland areas.

Description

An exceptionally attractive four bedroom detached house situated in one of Ickenham's most sought after roads. Requiring complete modernisation throughout, this characterful property offers abundant opportunities to create a stunning family home. The accommodation is entered via a spacious reception hall, through which there are doors to the two separate reception rooms, leading on from one of the reception rooms is the kitchen which is located to the read of the property. Additionally to the ground floor there is a guest cloakroom. The first floor offers four good sized bedrooms and a bathroom. The property requires full refurbishment throughout.

Outside

There is a large front garden mostly laid to lawn, and a driveway providing off-street parking for two/three vehicles. To the rear of the property there is a good sized garden, mostly laid to lawn with many mature trees providing immense privacy.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionFour bedroom double bay-fronted, Victorian semi-detached family home, in a premier location, positioned off Wanstead High Street.Lovingly occupied for a number of years as a family home, this delightful property now requires some modernisation. Retaining a host of period features, this is a fantastic opportunity for discerning purchasers to mastermind the perfect family home.The house is approached by a driveway with off-street parking for at least three vehicles. Internally the accommodation is arranged over two floors; The ground floor comprising a bay-fronted living room with feature fireplace, part open-plan to the dining room with matching fireplace and stripped wooden floorboards throughout. There is a third reception room to the rear of the ground floor and a separate kitchen. There is a garage which can be accessed from the garden and a full-width cellar. The first floor hosts four bedrooms all of which are a good size and a family bathroom.To the rear is a delightful, mature garden, with a large patio and pathway which leads to a studio towards the back of the garden. There is potential for a rear extension as others have done in the street, subject to the usual planning consents.Cambridge Road is well located for local amenities and the main High Street, which boasts a comprehensive selection of cafes, boutique shops, pubs and restaurants. Transport links into London are excellent with Wanstead underground (Central Line) the nearest station. There are several well regarded state and private schools within easy reach.

listing.description: Exceptionally rare opportunity - must be viewed to be fully appreciated! Located on a desirable road and offering over 2600 sqft of impressive accommodation is this truly superb and unique five bedroom house, on the market for the first time in 35 years.The property requires modernisation, however, it is perfectly suitable for someone to move into and gradually improve over time. There are a host of original features throughout including ceiling roses, cornicing and fireplaces. The spacious accommodation comprises entrance hall with WC, 17' reception room with bay window, a further reception room currently used as a library, kitchen with Aga, utility room, two large storage cupboards and access to the cellar. To the first floor there are three generous double bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the second floor there are a further two double bedrooms, kitchen area, bathroom and eaves storage. This floor would be perfect for families with older children wanting their own space or even a live in au pair.To the rear there is a good sized garden which is bisected by a stream; the fore being mainly laid to lawn and the rear a haven for wildlife. To the front there is off street parking and access to the garage. There is also further potential to extend to the side and rear (stp).The location is quite simply superb. Chislehurst train station is just a few minutes' walk away and offers regular services to Lewisham (for DLR), Central London and The City. Local shops can be found just at the end of the road on Chislehurst Road and there are many fine public houses and restaurants within walking distance. Some of the area's finest schools are nearby including the highly regarded Bullers Wood School for Girls.In our opinion this really is a one of a kind property which offers tremendous potential and should be viewed at your earliest opportunity.

Externally, the maure rear garden extends to approx in 75ft in depth and has a swimming pool (in need of restoration). The front driveway has off street parking for several cars and an integral garage. EPC E

listing.description: Elegant Three/Four Bedroom Period Home With Beautiful Finish.Period features and contemporary ingenuity marry perfectly in this elegant three/four bedroom period home. Generously arranged over three picture perfect floors, the property is superbly presented and beautifully arranged. Those Venetian plastered walls are simply divine! Further treats include six period fireplaces, original shutters, high ceilings and a lovely, secluded rear garden. The accommodation comprises two/three superb reception rooms, three/four double bedrooms, a bright, modern kitchen, bountiful bathroom and a guest wc. The property backs onto the very lovely Brunswick Park which enjoys a new play area. The new cafe is perfect for a weekend natter while the kids run amok. Camberwell boasts a healthy array of culinary attractions - best watch those waist lines! Transport is a cinch with nearby Denmark Hill and Oval and Elephant and Castle Tube a short bus ride.The raised ground floor entrance welcomes us through a walled front garden. Head up white painted steps to the front door. The entrance hall is bright and inviting and really has the wow-factor with those stunning Venetian plastered walls - they're so touchable! The original timber floors have been sanded and varnished and there is a rather grand staircase directly ahead. A step to the right reveals the first reception which boasts a magnificent sash bay with period shutters, superb (working) fireplace and marble mantel. A further reception comes next with another impressive fireplace and some calming rear leafy views. Currently used as a study the space could easily be used as a fourth bedroom. Back through the hall you'll find a handy guest wc with eco-loo. At the end of the hall you find an impressive family bathroom with fabulous walk-in shower, loo, heated towel rail and pretty roll top bath. Underfloor heating keeps the toes snug. Crisp white wooden panelling and royal blue walls finish it all off perfectly.Moving to the lower ground floor you'll meet a wonderful double reception that stretches the full length of the main footprint. There's a front aspect bay of sash windows and rear French doors. To the front there is a fireplace with a tasty art nouveau style mantel while the rear of the room has a striking original cast iron Victorian range with exposed brick feature wall. The hallway offers a further front access point with fitted security gate and recessed storage area — perfect for bikes and bins! Your kitchen is a real joy with chunky, solid oak worktops and five ring gas hob. The boiler was only fitted last year meaning you don't have to! An airy environment is guaranteed by a large side aspect casement window and further double glass doors leading to the patio. The garden itself is a delight! Leafy and peaceful and backing onto the very lovely Brunswick Park. It's full of mature shrubs, a well presented artificial lawn and scampering squirrels.The first floor plays host to three further double bedrooms. Spanning the entire width of the house the master enjoys a bright appointment with two impressive sash windows. There is an enchanting decorative fireplace flanked on either side by handsome fitted wooden wardrobes. Bedroom two also offers a period fireplace, fitted wardrobes and original cornicing. Bedroom three faces rear with lofty views over the enchanting south facing garden and Brunswick Park. The lower ceiling is made seamless with the inclusion of an overhead Velux installed while modernising the roof above.Take a 13 minute stroll up the very lovely Camberwell Grove to Denmark Hill station where you can pick up fast services to Victoria, Elephant and Castle, and Blackfriars. The London Overground line offers unbeatable links to Clapham, Shoreditch and Canary Wharf (via Canada Water). Any number of buses travelling through Camberwell will whizz you into the West End or City around the clock. There many excellent primary schools nearby rated Ofsted outstanding /good: Lyndhurst Primary, St John the Divine, Brunswick Park, Crawford Primary and the The Villa pre-preparatory and nursery school. James Allen Girls School, Alleyns and Dulwich College are also a short drive away and are renowned as some of the best independent secondary schools in the country.Camberwell is fast becoming a foodie's dream! We love 'Fladda and Theos', The Crooked Well for some refined pub grub and The Camberwell Arms, is wowing folk with it's innovative gastro food. Those looking to wash it all down with a nice pint are spoilt with TheTiger providing a vast array of ale and beer. For a more traditional experience hop over the road to The Hermit's Cave for a pint of the black stuff by the fire. Brunswick Park is right on your doorstep for when the sun is shining. It's gorgeous, family-friendly and has that new children's playground, lush picnic area, tennis courts and a multi-use games area. It's a fantastic spot to walk the dog. It also holds a number of family-friendly events throughout the year: Annual Fete, Easter Egg Hunt, "Scrufts" Dog Show to name but a few. A great community asset to have on your doorstep!

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: This unique, four-bedroom Edwardian house was built at the height of the Arts and Craft movement in 1908, on Woodlands Avenue in Wanstead. In recent years, the house has been modernised, with the addition of a copper-clad extension to the top floor, and an entire interior refurbishment by architectural designer, Leo Bachmann. Accommodation extends to 1,715 sq ft, overlooking an expansive back garden, a short distance from Wanstead Tube station.Now, the house embodies an honesty and integrity in materials synonymous with the doctrines of John Ruskin, William Morris and Augustus Pugin. It also exhibits refined instances of contemporary design, as seen in the master bedroom, which elegantly utilises the extended space to create an elevated sleeping quarters, with views over substantial gardens below and the treetops of Wansted Flats beyond.The front elevation of the house blends in seamlessly with its neighbours on Woodlands Avenue, a peaceful residential street. In terms of volume and configuration, this is as far the similarities extend. Beyond the entrance hall, Leo Bachmann has sought to create a series of spaces that flow seamlessly together, naturally emphasising the flow of natural light in his use of neutral tones and wood, from the rear of the house, right through to the original bay window at the front. A contemporary kitchen occupies this space in the house and has an island in arabescato marble, an original hearth and a built-in pine dresser. The dresser and cabinetry have been washed in Swedish floor soap, naturally dying the grain. Natural tones of Earthborn claypaint have been used throughout the house.Pine boards, treated with the same Swedish wash, run across the remainder of this floor, connecting the kitchen aesthetically to a dining area with original Edwardian fireplace and a hearth of quarry tiles. There is also a highly practical boot room and utility area with a butler sink and plenty of storage space. Beyond, is a newly-created living room, with a glazed roof and window seat with views out over garden. This area of the house has been insulated with Welsh wool.The garden is arguably one the house’s most attractive properties. It is south-facing, approximately fifty metres in length and has a paved patio space for outside dining. A mature bay tree is positioned to one side of this space, which produces wonderfully fragrant leaves for cooking. There is also a storage shed at the farthest end, as well as side access.The first floor is occupied by three bedrooms and a family bathroom with Graphenstone polished plaster. One of the bedrooms is currently arranged as a nursery and has a large bay window at the front of the house. Another is used as a study and has an original Edwardian tiled fireplace and re-claimed cast iron radiators, in addition to a beautifully curved wall. Original pine floorboards run across this level, which have also been organically washed.The second storey is occupied by the master bedroom suite. Exposed brickwork on the stairway leads up to a wonderfully bright space with a Juliet balcony at the rear offering wonderful views of the surrounding countryside, including the garden in the foreground, Wansted Flats in the distance and Epping Forest beyond. Panels of glazing in the ceiling also draw in light from above. The woodwork on this floor is Douglas Fir and extends to the en-suite bathroom which is partially open-plan, concealing a shower, bath and dressing area.The ethos of the Arts and Crafts movement is often viewed in opposition to the machine-friendly outlook of Modernism. However, both movements championed a truth and integrity in materials, while they may have deployed different design principles in service of their beliefs. This house embodies the best of both schools of thought, seeking to unify the old with the new in a tonally warm and earthy set of spaces which champion their materials, while emphasising space, light and the verdant surroundings, outside the walls of house.The house is excellently positioned for the shops, cafes and restaurants of Wanstead village. It is also within the catchment area of Alderbrook Primary school which was recently rated ‘outstanding’ by Ofsted.Green spaces abound. Wanstead Forest park, renowned locally for its carpet of bluebells, is positioned at the end of Woodlands Avenue, a two-minute walk from the house. Wanstead Flats constitutes the southern portion of Epping Forest and is one of the largest expanses of common land in London. The Flats have a number of established walks, with wonderful views of the city. Forest Gate can be accessed on foot via the flats and has a wide range of cafes, bars and restaurants.Woodlands Avenue is a five-minute bus ride from Leytonstone and Wanstead Tube stations where Central line services run to central London in approximately 20 minutes respectively. Leytonstone High Road station is slightly further afield and runs London Overground services through east London.

listing.description: A genuinely rare chance to acquire this two bedroom bay fronted Victorian period house in need of full modernisation and offering huge potential for extension. Located in the highly sought after 'Nightingale Triangle' close to Balham High Road with a choice of stations literally yards away; this well-proportioned end of terrace house has a 40 ft/50 ft South facing garden and is situated on a picturesque road in a quiet area close to central Balham. The current development plans afford the opportunity to increase the size of the footprint to approximately one thousand three hundred and fifty square feet; this increases to approximately one thousand eight hundred square feet if adding a lower ground floor or basement. Full planning permission was granted in October 2018 (Wandsworth bc 2018/1396). listing.description: Superbly located in one of the best positions on this highly regarded development fronting onto a large open greenwood area with duck pond is this four double bedroom detached family home which has recently undergone a full program of modernisation and refurbishment. The property now absolutely must be viewed personally for its location and condition to be fully appreciated. In brief, to the first floor there are the four double bedrooms including an exceptional master bedroom with refitted en suite shower room in addition there is a luxuriously appointed family bathroom with separate shower. To the ground floor, a spacious reception hall with solid oak flooring provides access to accommodation incorporating an attractive and comfortable lounge 20’ x 13’7”, a study/TV room 13’7” x 8’3” and a fabulous custom fitted kitchen/dining/family room of around 24’ x 22’. In addition there is a refitted ground floor cloakroom. The property affords gas central heating via radiators and double glazed windows throughout. As previously mentioned the property is set within one of the best locations on this development fronting onto the green and pond and affords a road frontage of around 67’. The front garden has a block paved parking area for around three/four cars leading to an attached double width garage. To the rear, the south facing rear garden is completely secluded and measures approximately 67’ x 50’. We cannot over emphasize the need for a personal inspection to fully appreciate the size and quality of accommodation offered together with its location. Ref No. 4859-18. EPC D.

listing.description: Entering the property on the ground floor, you are greeted by a long corridor with a double reception room to the right. The reception room is generous in size with space for two seating areas and large sash windows at each end of the room; allowing for an abundance of light.Downstairs on the lower ground floor are the kitchen and dining room, with space for a large dining table and chairs. There is also a sizable storage cupboard at front of the room and some fitted storage along one side.The kitchen itself has plenty of storage and worktop space, a gas hob with oven below and extractor fan above, space for a washing machine and an integrated fridge/freezer.Continue up to the first floor where there are two bedrooms and a bathroom. Both bedrooms could have a double bed, as well as free-standing storage. The bathroom contains a bath with overhead shower, wash basin with mirror above, large storage cupboard and a W.C.The top floor of the house also has two bedrooms, with the larger located at the front of the property. Both rooms are big enough for a double bed and free-standing storage.The garden is accessed from the ground floor at the rear of the property and is a generous size, currently paved with a garden shed at the back. It is also almost directly south facing. Also, on this level next to the door to the garden is a convenient W.C. For guests.Location:Sutherland Square is both charming and elegant, whilst being conveniently situated just off the vibrant Walworth Road, which is bursting with amenities. Heading south you will find Burgess Park with its tea rooms and tennis courts and north, you will find the trendy street food market of Mercato Metropolitano; a must for any resident.Directions:Walworth Road is well served by a frequent bus service to Elephant & Castle Underground/Overground Station; which takes you onward into Central London and even out to the home counties. Kennington Underground Station (Northern Line – both branches) is only a mere 0.6 mile walk away.

listing.description: Fine and Country. An ultra-modern house which has undergone extensive building, extending and modernising works. The interior is faultless; immaculate and functional. Located in the heart of South Cheam, the surrounding area is extremely affluent and sought after.The house has virtually been rebuilt since its purchase. The benefit of such a house is the assurance of mod cons such as underfloor heating, built-in CCTV and fashionable fixtures.Taking full advantage of the corner plot, the house has a wide driveway and ample off-street parking. The exterior of the house, both front and back, has a minimalist modern look and this design continues throughout the interior; straight lines and cool off-whites and greys feature.The accommodation comprises four bedrooms, two bathrooms, four reception rooms, kitchen family room, utility room and downstairs cloakroom/WC. The master suite rewards the heads of the household with a dressing area, en-suite and bedroom. The kitchen family room, with its large bi-fold doors, central island and integrated Siemens appliances is the room which families crave and will move for. The other reception rooms provide either work from home space or areas to lounge in comfort. The reception rooms provide flexibility of use and a chance to create annexes and or ground floor bedrooms should you require them.The rear garden is incredibly easy to use and will appeal to families of all ages. The sleek patio, fenced borders and large lawn are impressive and can be admired through the bi-fold doors off the kitchen family room. The addition of remote controlled garden lights will enable alfresco dining or social gatherings to continue into the evening during the summer months.South Cheam is a favourable area within the wider Sutton borough of Greater London with surroundings mostly made up of avenues and roads offering large detached houses. Existing owners rarely move out of the area and new owners are attracted by the schooling, community feel and a peaceful environment in which to start a family. Nearby Cheam Village has its own train station offering services into London Victoria and London Bridge whilst the high street provides restaurants including Pizza Express and Prezzo, coffee shops such as Costa and an array of shops including a butcher, bakers, Waitrose and Sainsbury s. The village has much of what most require on a day to day basis whilst the neighbouring towns of Sutton and Epsom and further afield Kingston and Croydon offer more extensive shopping experiences. Schooling is excellent, sports facilities abundant and the setting on the borders of North Surrey provides a leafy green appeal.Fine and Country market the very best property and we highly recommend your interest. This house allows you to move in and live life. We look forward to showing you.Entrance HallKitchen Into Family / Dining RoomUtility RoomSitting RoomStudioStudyCloakroom / WCFirst Floor LandingMaster Bedroom WithDressing Room And En-SuiteThree Further BedroomFamily BathroomOutsideGardenImportant note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller./1

listing.description: LocationThis unique detached family home is coming to the market for the first time in over 20 years! With accommodation arranged over three floors there is ample living and entertaining space to meet the needs of an aspiring modern family; Entering the property via the front aspect veranda into the welcoming entrance hall you will find the fully equipped kitchen breakfast room with granite work tops and under unit lighting, a cloakroom., The inter communicating family room / reception room has internal French doors to the main living room and a spiral stair case to the lower floor. The living room is open to the dining room with a dual aspect and also has doors leading to the raised decked terrace. Following the spiral stair case to the lower floor you enter a perfect room currently used as a home office that has patio doors to the garden, from here you can access a bright reception room / family room then following the internal hall way you are led to the double integral garage and bedroom 5 / guest bedroom plus a family bathroom. Returning to the main entrance and taking the stairs to the top floor you will find 4 big bright double bedrooms and another bathroom with separate shower cubicle. To the front of the property is a sweeping drive way leading to off street parking for approx. 10 cars. The Rear garden is mature, established and screened from neighbours. This extremely spacious and adaptable home requires a degree of re-modernisation internally and externally but is an opportunity not to be missed for buyers looking to acquire a forever home.

Fees to Tenants
Prospective tenants interested in renting a property through Goldschmidt & Howland will need to be aware of the following pre-tenancy costs that may be due prior to the commencement of a tenancy. Please further note that in some situations properties may be advertised on behalf of another agency, in which case the following fees and charges may vary and prospective tenants will be advised of any such variation in fees and charges upon enquiry.

Before you move in...

Reservation Fee - Equivalent to two weeks rent - deductible from the first month's rental if the tenancy proceeds.

Please note that should the tenant withdraw their application to rent the property at any time, through no fault of the landlord, or the tenant fails the referencing process, or fails to provide the required information in accordance with the referencing criteria provided, or it is established that the tenant or any of their dependents do not have the right to rent in the UK, the tenant will be required to compensate the landlord and Goldschmidt & Howland by paying up to the full amount of the Reservation Fee the reasonable costs incurred in preparing the property for the tenancy or complying with any of the special conditions as requested by the tenant. If the property is withdrawn from the market the tenant will also be required to compensate the landlord for an amount equal to the rent for the period that the property is withdrawn from the market.

Tenancy Agreement Fee
£180.00 (inc VAT) per tenancy. Preparation and drawing up of the Tenancy Agreement.

Please note that both the Tenancy Agreement Fee and Reference Fee are non-refundable should the tenancy be aborted through no fault of the landlord, this may include (but not limited to) the tenants decision to withdraw from the tenancy prior to the signing of the tenancy agreement, if the tenant or guarantor fails the referencing process or it is established that the tenant or any of their dependents do not have the right to rent in the UK.

Reference Fee
£48.00 (inc VAT) per Tenant /Guarantor
£84.00 inc VAT for Company

Security Deposit
Equivalent to 6 weeks rent.

Pet Deposit
In addition to the Security Deposit, a further 2 weeks rent will be required for pets.

During your tenancy...

Amendment/Change of Tenant Fee
£500.00 (inc VAT) Contract negotiation, amending terms and updating your tenancy agreement during the tenancy. Each new tenant will be subject to referencing and liable for the Reference Fee of £48.00 (inc VAT) per tenant or guarantor.

Renewal Fee
£84.00 (inc VAT) Contract negotiation and arranging a paperwork.

At the end of your tenancy...

Check out Fee
This cost is dependent on the size of the property - prices inclusive of VAT:

Studio £78 - £144
1 Bed £102 - £144
2 Bed £108 - £156
3 Bed £120 - £192
4 bed £138 - £258
5 Bed + £180 - £288

Early Termination Fee - Should you agree with the landlord to terminate your tenancy before you are permitted to do so, you will be responsible for the repayment of the pro-rata letting or renewal fee paid in advance by the landlord for the period of the tenancy agreed up until it could lawfully be ended by the tenant, plus any additional reasonable costs incurred by the landlord in the re-letting of the property.

Other fees and charges...

Unpaid Rent/Returned Payments - Interest at 4% above Bank of England Base Rate from date due.

listing.description: A beautiful example of a four double bedroom Victorian terraced house, located on a quiet and sleepy street between the amenities in Clapham and Brixton. Margate Road is located in a popular residential pocket of pretty Victorian terraces, equidistant to both sought-after locations, and will appeal to purchasers who are contemplating moving to the two areas.This property has been lovingly modernised and extended by its present owners within the last three years, whilst maintaining great sensitivity to the charm of this period. This includes a fantastically designed side extension with large glass panels and multiple skylights. The stunning kitchen diner has concertina doors that allow the living space to flood seamlessly into the well-maintained, landscaped secluded garden at the rear. The double aspect reception and dining room is packed full of character with wooden flooring, a feature fireplace, bespoke shelving and double glazed sash windows.The first floor comprises a beautiful master bedroom running the width of the building with high ceilings and views over the neighbouring terrace row, two further double bedrooms and a beautifully finished shower room, boasting a stylish walk-in shower. Stairs lead to the second floor and a wonderful loft style bedroom with skylights and views over the neighbouring gardens at the rear, plus a second luxurious family bathroom.With nearly 1400 square feet of internal living space this chain-free property is a fantastic family home with a beautifully light and airy contemporary finish, ample built-in storage and ideal for any purchasers looking to move into a new house hassle-free.This lovely home is nestled on Margate Road, a peaceful road which is highly sought after for its character, feel and proximity to both Brixton and Clapham. The bars and restaurants of Acre Lane are a short walk and within an eleven minute stroll down the road is everything that Brixton has to offer, from music venues and the extremely popular Brixton Village, to large brand shops and cracking transport links. The vibrant and diverse Clapham High Street is an eleven minute walk in the other direction, offering great nightlife and culinary delights. Potential purchasers will benefit from both the Northern Line (Clapham North, Clapham Common and Clapham South tube stations) and the Victoria Line (Brixton tube station). With the wonderful green spaces of Brockwell Park and its iconic 1930s Lido also within easy reach, the location cannot be understated. There are few properties in the area that have as many positive attributes, from the style, size, outside space and the proximity to all the action the area has to offer.
listing.short_description: A spacious, well-designed four double bedroom Victorian house located in a residential pocket equidistant to Brixton and Clapham.

listing.description: A beautiful early Victorian semi detached family house of Townscape Merit located in the heart of Kingston town centre, with the convenience of a private driveway and off street parking as well as extremely generous and, secluded rear garden. In need of some modernisation, it comes with excellent proportions and wonderful character features throughout. The ground floor offers two reception rooms, both with feature fireplaces, as well as a very large separate kitchen, whilst beyond that comes an additional shower room and W.C. The first floor is arranged over a bright split level and comprises three double bedrooms as well as further generous single bedroom and bathroom. Excellent storage is provided in the form of a loft and cellar. Externally, the property opens out onto an a very generous and private rear garden with wide side return and access back to the front of the house. Planning permission has also been granted for a large kitchen extension encompassing the outside conservatory area. Orchard Road is situated in the heart of Kingston town centre and benefits from the convenience of being within walking distance of just about all local amenities. Kingston's Zone 6 railway station is within a 0.4 mile (8 minute walk) of the property. Access to both the River Thames is great, whilst Richmond Park's Kingston Gate offers the opportunity to enjoy the largest Royal Park in London covering an area of 2,500 acres. From its heights, uninterrupted views of St Paul's Cathedral can be enjoyed, 12 miles away, whilst the Isabella Plantation offers a 40 acre Victorian woodland garden created in the 1830's and is best known for its evergreen azaleas, which line the ponds and streams. Created by Charles I in the 17th century as a deer park, it is of national and international importance for wildlife conservation. Furthemore, Fairfield Recreation Ground is within moments of the property. Kingston town centre offers a varied and comprehensive choice in shops via the High Street and Clarence Street as well as both Bentalls & John Lewis department stores. Kingston Riverside also offers a number of well known and popular restaurants.
listing.short_description: A beautiful early Victorian semi detached family house of Townscape Merit located in the heart of Kingston town centre, with the convenience of a private driveway and off street parking as well as extremely generous and, secluded rear garden.

listing.letting_fees:
Tenants Pre-Tenancy Charges & Costs:

Please be aware that if you are a prospective tenant interested in renting a property via Parkheath the following costs will usually be due prior to the commencement of a tenancy – (where we are advertising a property on behalf of another letting or managing agent, the fees may differ from the below and we will inform you on enquiry) :-

Reservation Fee

This is usually paid when you have agreed an offer, equivalent to 2 weeks rent and can be deducted from the first monthly rent when the tenancy proceeds. Further details will be contained within the reservation fee form.

Tenancy Administration Fee

In order to process the new tenancy and issue the Tenancy Agreements a fee of £199.00 inc VAT will be charged per tenancy (for 2 tenants and £99.00 inc VAT for each additional tenant)
Reference Fee

£30.00 inc VAT minimum per Tenant or Guarantor being referenced. (Student with Guarantor and Fast-Track references are charged at £60.00 inc VAT and international credit reports can cost up to £75.00 inc VAT.

Security Deposit

This is usually equivalent to 6 weeks rent and will be held in accordance with the Government Tenancy Deposit Guidelines and may be returned at the end of a Tenancy. Higher deposits can be requested for various reasons such as the added risk to property due to pets etc.

Check in and Check Out Inventory Costs

It is usually the Tenants responsibility to pay for the check-out inventory at the end of the tenancy when renting a property via Parkheath. This will be detailed within the Tenancy Agreement. The cost varies depending on the size of the property and if you do not attend an appointment, you may be charged an abortive fee. Please ask a member of staff for approximate prices.

Credit/Debit Card Fees

Each debit card transaction will be charged at £1.00 and each credit card transaction will be charged at 2.75% of the total amount.

Tenants Fees During or at the end of a Tenancy:

Renewal Fees

In the event of a Tenant renewing their tenancy after the initial fixed term, there will be a Renewal of Tenancy Administration fee of £90.00 inc VAT per extension thereof.

Unpaid Rent and Returned Payments

Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate may be charged from the rent due date if not received.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

We could not recommend this property any more highly.

listing.description: Positioned in a highly sought after location in West Purley is this impressive 5 bedroom detached family home offering spacious accommodation and potential for someone to put there own stamp on it.Property  Positioned in a highly sought after location in West Purley is this impressive five bedroom detached family home offering spacious accommodation and potential for someone to put there own stamp on it.An outstanding modern built property will prove popular with its close proximity to highly rated schools and situated on a quiet residential road. The downstairs accommodation offers a spacious L shaped lounge / dining room, kitchen / breakfast room with eye level wall and base units, a separate study, utility room with access to a double integral garage, and a downstairs cloakroom.The upstairs consists of five good size bedrooms, three in which benefit from built in wardrobes. The master bedroom has an en suite and there is a separate family bathroom to accommodate the other 4 bedrooms.Outside, the secluded rear garden is on level grounds and is southerly facing with fenced established boundaries.The property is set back off the road and has ample parking.Location  Great Woodcote Park is a highly sought after road situated in the favoured west side of Purley. The property is situated on the south side of the road close to the turning with Church Road.The property is within reasonable walking distance (about three quarters of a mile) from Purley station which provides fast rail services to London Victoria and London Bridge (from 23 minutes).As well as numerous leisure facilities including Golf Clubs, Tennis and Squash Clubs and swimming baths, the area is extremely well served with an excellent choice of schools including Whitgift, Trinity, John Fisher, Cumnor House, Wallington Girls and Woodcote.A variety of shopping facilities can be found at both Purley and Coulsdon town centres including Tesco, Waitrose and Aldi whilst, the more comprehensive shopping facilities, including the forthcoming Westfield, can be found in Croydon, approximately four miles away.

Off of the entrance hall you will find a downstairs WC and access to the living room and dining area plus a courtesy door to the integral garage. The fitted kitchen to the rear overlooks the gardens and has a separate breakfast room as well. You will also find another room that could be used as a study or utility room.An open tread staircase leads to the first floor landing and the four well-proportioned bedrooms.The master bedroom suite is a very generous 20' x 12' and has its own dressing room and en suite bathroom. All of the bedrooms are double size and there is also a modern family bathroom. Both bathrooms have been modernised recently and there is a new pressurised hot water system and alarm.Outside, there is a large driveway providing off-street parking for several vehicles and this also leads to a double width garage. The rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with flower and shrub borders.Brimstone Close is situated just off Worlds End Lane with glorious Kent countryside close by. The nearest station at Chelsfield, with its direct service into London in around 30 minutes, is just over half a mile away (as the crow flies) and Junction 4 of M25 is within a mile and a half.The town centre of Orpington is under two miles away and has a comprehensive range of shops and facilities including the Walnuts Shopping Centre and Odeon cinema. Sports facilities are also well catered for with the Walnuts Leisure Centre, golf courses, football and rugby clubs all within the area. A little way out of town you will find larger stores at the Nugent Retail Park along with electrical superstores, furniture shops and diy centres along the Sevenoaks Way. Shopping centres at Bluewater and Bromley can also be found within 10 miles drive or bus ride.

listing.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this beautiful, spacious and rarely available four bedroom family home. The property is located on Oak Lodge Avenue, which is accessible from Manor Road in Chigwell. The property retains a wealth of features, and has been imaginatively developed and modernised to a very high standard. The ground floor consists of a tiled entrance porch, 17 ft hallway, ground floor WC, 29 ft lounge family room, converted garage offering a further play room of 14 ft, high specification 18ft kitchen diner with skylights and bi-fold doors and a handy separate utility room.The first floor has been improved to offer a master bedroom with en-suite, three further bedrooms and a family bathroom. The properties loft space, like many other on Oak Lodge Avenue could easily be converted to offer a fifth bedroom and second en-suite.Externally, the property has a large driveway, suitable for at least three vehicles. To the rear is a beautiful 100 ft garden with a raised block paved seating area, further artificial lawn area flowing into a hard standing area ready for a summer house. With block paved seating area.The considerable array of contemporary amenities available on Chigwell High Road is within a short distance, and includes a wide selection of fashionable restaurants, delicatessens, cafes and independently owned shops and boutiques. The property is also conveniently located for a choice oflocal supermarkets and for Hainualt Forest, which offers varied outdoor pursuits to walkers, runners, and cyclists. We highly recommend an internal inspection, as properties of this size and location are very rarely marketed. Viewings can be booked and confirmed instantly via the Purple Bricks website 24/7.Seller’s Comments"We bought the house back in 2011 from a lady who was elderly and hadn't modernised for a long time. Over a period of 6 months we renovated the house and extended to the side and rear, creating an additional bedroom, bathroom, reception room and utility room. Attention to detail has always been important to us. We replaced all of the electrics and the heating system and put in a Megaflow tank along with a new boiler. Both bathrooms have underfloor heating. The kitchen is a luxury high specification German brand with bespoke Corian work surfaces. We also had all the windows and doors replaced and added bi-folding doors to the kitchen and had a custom made front door. The garden was also a big project and we flattened the lawn area and put down artificial grass but left the original apple tree from the orchard before the house was built. We will be very sad to leave this house as it has many good memories and Oak Lodge Avenue is a lovely, community based road to live with so many great people"

listing.description: This stunning detached house located in one of Whittons premier roads is presented to the market in fantastic condition throughout. The property benefits from a bright feature open plan kitchen breakfast room which is fitted to a very high standard and benefits from views of rear garden. This light and airy room with its skylight windows is the hub of the home and really needs to be seen to be appreciated. There is also utility room running off the kitchen. The kitchen/breakfast room has double doors leading onto a large family room/lounge. There is also a large second reception room. Upstairs the property boast 5 double bedrooms and 4 bathrooms. The master bedroom also boasts with a range of fitted wardrobes and access to the beautifully fitted en suite shower room. There is a further fabulous en suite shower room to bedroom two and a high quality family bathroom. The property has been modernised to a very high standard throughout by the present owners and early viewings are recommended to appreciate the overall quality of this family home. Other benefits include double glazing, gas central heating, a private driveway. The property is located less that 0.5 of a mile from Whitton High Street and British Rail station.

listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.
listing.description: This Three bedroom 1930s well presented character detached property is situated in a residential road within the highly sought after Knoll area. With planning permission granted to convert into a four bedroom property over three floors the top floor bedroom with en suite. Along with the planning permission, there is further potential to extend to the side of the property due to the wide frontage, although this would be stpp.Keswick road is 0.6 miles to Orpington main line station offering a fast service to London Bridge as well as serving London terminals in the West End and City.The property boasts a wealth of character and charm whilst also being modernised and well-presented throughout.The ground floor accommodation comprises a wonderful oak floored welcoming hallway with its own feature fireplace. This in turn provides access to again oak floored living room with duel aspect windows a feature bay window and marble fireplace. The living room opens onto the dining area with wonderful views over the South East facing garden. The bespoke 'Great British' kitchen features granite work tops, Rangemaster cooker and Amtico flooring also. It overlooks the garden with double doors on to the patio area which leads to the heated swimming pool. The kitchen provides access to the utility room with larder and storage cupboard.The first floor of the property has been lovingly maintained and unchanged from its original three bedroom layout. All bedrooms are doubles two of which offer double bedrooms and duel aspect windows. There is also a well sized family bathroom.The current vendor has planning permission to develop the loft which offers an opportunity to make this 4 bedroom property with added en suite.To the rear there is a garden stretching approximately 100ft and South East facing garden. The garden also hosts the heated swimming pool and gym.The front features off street parking on the driveway which offers space for two cars as well as a garage.
listing.short_description: This Three bedroom 1930s well presented character detached property is situated in a residential road within the highly sought after Knoll area. With planning permission granted to convert into a four bedroom property over three floors.

listing.description: Robsons are delighted to offer for sale this unique and characterful home positioned at the end of a private drive moments from the centre of Northwood. This grade 2 listed property believed to date back to the early 16th century oozes charm, set back on a large plot surrounded by established trees the property boast off street parking for multiple vehicles, 2 detached single garages and secluded rear garden. Internally the property presents 3/4 bedrooms and 2 reception rooms. The property is maintained to character but would benefit from some modernisation. This is a wonderful opportunity for the right buyer to obtain a truly unique home. Internal viewing is highly recommended. Sole agents.Northwood provides a range of shopping facilities, a Waitrose supermarket, restaurants and the Metropolitan Line Station providing access to Baker Street and the city beyond. The area has a range of both private and state schools. Places of worship and recreational facilities are also well catered for in the surrounding area and major motorway links to M25 and M1 are nearby.

Built in 2001 and still occupied by the original owners, it was the room sizes and the brilliant layout that first caught their eye, together with the attractive aesthetic design and position within this small development of executive homes. With 2 en-suites, a family bathroom, good bedroom sizes, and an abundance of storage, built in wardrobes and downstairs living accommodation to match, the home is perfectly suited to the needs of a large family with teenagers. listing.description: A fabulous four double bedroom, three bathroom detached family home that has been extended and modernised by the current owners and approximately measures 1900 sq ft. The property is located on a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon with the added bonus of being in the catchment area for Bishopshalt senior school along with a number of other well regarded schools. Uxbridge town centre and Hillingdon tube station are within walking distance. Outside there is off street parking for numerous cars and a landscaped rear garden that backs onto Hillingdon cricket fields.DirectionsFrom leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and take the first turning on your left into Vine Lane.SituationVine Lane is a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon with the added bonus of being in the catchment area for Bishopshalt senior school along with a number of other well regarded schools. A range of recreational facilities are also nearby such as Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park and the fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Piccadilly/Metropolitan Line Station is a short distance away along with the A40/M40/M4 and M25 giving access to London and the Home Counties along with Heathrow Airport.DescriptionA fabulous four double bedroom, three bathroom detached family home that has been extended and modernised by the current owners and approximately measures 1900 sq ft. The porch provides access into the central hallway with doors leading into the 19ft lounge and 21ft lx 19ft luxury kitchen that is open plan to an 11ft dining area. Off the kitchen is an inner hallway that leads into the 9ft office, ground floor W.C and 19ft garage which has the potential to convert (S.T.P). To the first floor you have a 14ft master bedroom with ensuite shower room, 12ft second bedroom, 13ft third bedroom, 12ft fourth bedroom, second shower room and family bathroom.OutsideThe front of the property has a block paved carriage driveway leading onto the 19ft garage creating off street parking for numerous cars with a variety of shrubs and plants along the borders. To the rear is a landscaped garden that is mainly laid to lawn and backs directly onto Hillingdon cricket club. There is a patio area across the rear of the property with a decked area to the side. Along the borders are a variety of shrubs and trees.
listing.short_description:
A fabulous four double bedroom, three bathroom detached family home that has been extended and modernised by the current owners and approximately measures 1900 sq ft. The property is located on a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon with the added bonus of being in the catchment area for Bishopshalt senior school along with a number of other well regarded schools. Uxbridge town centre and Hillingdon tube station are within walking distance. Outside there is off street parking for numerous cars and a landscaped rear garden that backs onto Hillingdon cricket fields.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and take the first turning on your left into Vine Lane.

Situation

Vine Lane is a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon with the added bonus of being in the catchment area for Bishopshalt senior school along with a number of other well regarded schools. A range of recreational facilities are also nearby such as Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park and the fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Piccadilly/Metropolitan Line Station is a short distance away along with the A40/M40/M4 and M25 giving access to London and the Home Counties along with Heathrow Airport.

Description

A fabulous four double bedroom, three bathroom detached family home that has been extended and modernised by the current owners and approximately measures 1900 sq ft. The porch provides access into the central hallway with doors leading into the 19ft lounge and 21ft lx 19ft luxury kitchen that is open plan to an 11ft dining area. Off the kitchen is an inner hallway that leads into the 9ft office, ground floor W.C and 19ft garage which has the potential to convert (S.T.P). To the first floor you have a 14ft master bedroom with ensuite shower room, 12ft second bedroom, 13ft third bedroom, 12ft fourth bedroom, second shower room and family bathroom.

Outside

The front of the property has a block paved carriage driveway leading onto the 19ft garage creating off street parking for numerous cars with a variety of shrubs and plants along the borders. To the rear is a landscaped garden that is mainly laid to lawn and backs directly onto Hillingdon cricket club. There is a patio area across the rear of the property with a decked area to the side. Along the borders are a variety of shrubs and trees.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: A rare opportunity to acquire this enchanting Grade II Listed house which exudes character and charm throughout.Upland Court was built in 1910 in an Arts and Crafts style attributed to the renowned architect mh Baillie Scott. It is now divided into three separate wings and is approached via a long gated private driveway just off Batchworth Lane. This two bedroom house has been sympathetically modernised, retaining much of the period charm with a fusion of modern contemporary style. The ground floor comprises an entrance hall with guest cloakroom and double doors leading through to a sitting room with French doors out to the private rear garden.The kitchen/dining room is fitted with a range of white high gloss units, contrasting granite worktops and integrated appliances, plus a utility room.Northwood provides a range of shopping facilities including Waitrose supermarket, a variety of restaurants and other amenities with the Metropolitan Line station providing access to Baker Street and the City. There is a plethora of state and private schooling together with a wide choice of recreational facilities, which include golf courses and fitness centres. The M1, M40 and M25 motorways are also accessible.To the first floor there are two double bedrooms with vaulted beamed ceilings, built in wardrobes and ensuite facilities. Outside is a small private rear garden which is mostly laid to lawn, with a patio seating area and storage shed. Ample parking is provided at the front.

listing.description: Situated in an attractive street is this charming Victorian terraced house which has been extended into the loft and rear and has been extensively modernised throughout. The well-presented interiors are decorated in a contemporary style including wood and tiled floors, fitted storage and bespoke shutters in the sitting area.On the ground floor there is a 22ft reception space with fireplace leading to a smart bespoke kitchen/dining room flooded with natural light by a roof- light from above, underfloor heating and bifold doors opening to the garden.The first floor has two double bedrooms and a family bathroom with both freestanding bath and walk-in glass shower, while the third floor has a third spacious bedroom with ample eaves storage.To the rear of the property there is a delightful west-facing courtyard garden laid to timber decking with mature planting providing a secluded feel.Within easy reach of the house are three stations (Kensal Rise, Kensal Green tube and Queen’s Park) and the many shops and restaurants of Salusbury and Chamberlayne Road. Also easily accessible are the green spaces of Queen’s Park and Kensal Green cemetery.
